snippet: An agent for the sprinters Asafa Powell and Sherone Simpson said he believed their positive tests for a banned stimulant were attributable to a Canadian trainer working with the team.
abstract: Paul Doyle, agent for sprinters Asafa Powell and Sherone Simpson, who acknowledge they tested positive for banned stimulant, blames test result on trainer Christopher Xuereb; World Anti-Doping Agency guidelines say every athlete is responsible for ensuring that banned substances do not enter his or her body.

byline.original: By MARY PILON and GAIA PIANIGIANI
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Rome and Mary Pilon from New York.

lead_paragraph: An agent for the sprinters Asafa Powell and Sherone Simpson said he believed their positive tests for a banned stimulant were attributable to a Canadian trainer working with the team.

headline.main: Agent Blames Trainer for Sprinters’ Failed Drug Tests
headline.print_headline: Agent Blames Trainer for Drug-Test Failures
